speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, Dr. Crane.

speaker: Niles
text: [_into phone:_] My God, after all our years together - all the good times, all the bad times - you can't loan me a meager four thousand dollars?  You must appreciate how hard it is for me to approach you about this.  I thought I meant more to you than this, but apparently I don't. [_hangs up_] And they call themselves "the friendly bank!"

speaker: Martin
text: What do you need to borrow money for?

speaker: Niles
text: I saw the most exquisite Biedermeier footstool.

speaker: Martin
text: For four thousand bucks?  Niles, your mother and I didn't pay that much for our first house.

speaker: Niles
text: I know, dad.  I lived there.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I keep telling you, you don't have Maris's money to throw around anymore.  You're going to have to start cutting back a little.

speaker: Niles
text: I have cut back.  Last month I told my masseur I could only see him once a week.

speaker: Martin
text: [_sarcastic:_] Oh, I remember that scene in "Grapes Of Wrath" when Ma Joad did that.

speaker: Daphne
text: You know, if you need to save a bit, you should do what I do and cut out coupons.

speaker: Niles
text: [_interested:_] Coupons.  Well, what a wonderful way to economize.  Well, I could clip them and give them to my personal shopper.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Niles, good morning.

speaker: Niles
text: Hey.

speaker: Frasier
text: Daphne, has Bebe Glazer called back yet?

speaker: Daphne
text: 'Fraid not.

speaker: Niles
text: You're still consorting with that barracuda?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, a barracuda is what you want in an agent, Niles. It's just that the station's been sold, I was hoping she might have some scuttlebutt on the new owner.

speaker: Frasier
text: I must admit she's rather hard to get a hold of these days.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, really?  I thought one just drew a pentagram on the floor and chanted "I summon thee" three times.  _Frasier opens the door to Roz, who is carrying a file of news clippings._

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello, Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: Hey.

speaker: Frasier
text: What have you got on the new owner?

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, plenty.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yeah?

speaker: Roz
text: His name is Wilford S. Boone, but he likes to be called "Big Willy."

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, there's a little snapshot of his psyche right there.

speaker: Roz
text: He's an eighty-five year-old Texan.  Practically no formal education but he went from errand boy at a radio station to owning his own media empire worth six hundred million.

speaker: Niles
text: [_distracted by coupon:_] This is great, I don't even know what "Renuzit" is, but it's twenty cents off and I want it.

speaker: Roz
text: You're clipping coupons?

speaker: Niles
text: [_proudly_] I'm economizing.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh well it's about time, you spend money like a drunken sailor.

speaker: Niles
text: She said authoritatively.

speaker: Frasier
text: Excuse me, could we get back to the subject at hand, please?

speaker: Martin
text: What are you so antsy about?

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, Wilford S. Boone-

speaker: Roz
text: Big Willy.

speaker: Frasier
text: Please, Roz, I just can't say that yet, alright? - Wilford S. Boone owns thirty radio stations across the country.  If he likes you he's been known to syndicate your show nationwide. So, I'm trying to find out if we have anything in common - an angle, if you will.  So what are his interests, Roz?

speaker: Roz
text: Well, it's all in there.  He likes whittling, rodeos, the novels of Zane Grey...

speaker: Martin
text: [_sarcastic:_] Gee, Fras.  It's like you two were separated at birth.

speaker: Roz
text: He also owns a 5,000 acre cattle ranch and the world's largest collection of antique six-shooters.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh dear God, I'm sucking up to Yosemite Sam! _FADE OUT  Scene Two - Radio Station. Roz and Frasier are walking along the corridors towards the recording booth._

speaker: Roz
text: I think if we really want to impress Big Willy we should think of some Western theme to do for the show today.

speaker: Frasier
text: Great idea, Roz. [_sarcastic:_] Why don't we just start the show off with a segment on how to get in touch with your inner young'un.  _Frasier and Roz bump into Bulldog who is listening to Gil's show through the door._

speaker: Gil
text: [_in booth_] What a fascinating theory!  Do go on.

speaker: Frasier
text: What's going on?

speaker: Bulldog
text: Oh, this is great.  I told Gil the new station owner is a Greek tycoon.

speaker: Frasier
text: He fell for that?

speaker: Bulldog
text: Hook, line, and souvlaki!

speaker: Gil
text: You can keep your overripe Camembert and malodorous Stilton, they can't compare with the salty insouciance of Greece's glorious Feta.  It's not just for shepherds anymore!  This is Gil Chesterton saying _Bon Appetite_ , or as we say in Athens,

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh Gil, you've been had.  The new station owner isn't Greek, he's from Texas.

speaker: Bulldog
text: [_to Gil_] You are so easy!

speaker: Gil
text: Well, I hope you're happy!  I've just given four stars to a restaurant called "A Taste Of Greece."  Which, trust me, is no misnomer.

speaker: Bulldog
text: Well that's what you deserve, trying to suck up to some senile old coot! _The senile old coot - dressed in boots, string tie, and a cowboy hat - enters the booth and hears him without Bulldog noticing._

speaker: Bulldog
text: Hell, he probably can't eat anything but strained peas and farina! [_laughs_]

speaker: Frasier
text: [_stopping him:_] Uh, Mr Boone?

speaker: Boone
text: [_strong Texan accent:_] Yeah, that's right.

speaker: Frasier
text: Pleasure to see you.  I'm Dr. Frasier Crane.  This is Roz Doyle, Gil Chesterton and... [_points at Bulldog_]

speaker: Bulldog
text: [_covering up:_] I'm Skippy the lunch boy.  So, uh, that's two strained peas and a farina for the big guy. [_exits_]

speaker: Gil
text: Oh, uh, Skippy?  Change my order!  I've got a sudden hankering for baby-back ribs and corn bread. [_exits after him_]

speaker: Boone
text: Oh, I've been looking for you Dr. Crane.  I have a little problem and they told me you're just the fella who could fix it.  Oh, I hope I'm not imposing.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, no, don't be silly, Mr. Boone.

speaker: Boone
text: Well, actually I prefer "Big Willy."

speaker: Frasier
text: Don't be silly, Big Willy. [_Roz and Frasier keep in their laughter_]

speaker: Boone
text: You see, I'm engaged to be married.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, congratulations.

speaker: Boone
text: Well, sweet young thing.  Just nuts about me.  Problem is, she smokes.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh lord, that is a very bad habit.

speaker: Boone
text: Oh, it's a vile habit!  Would have destroyed my affection for her if, well she didn't possess certain... compensating gifts. [_Frasier and Roz trade a look._] Anyway, as a favour to me, could you help her?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I'll certainly try.  Just keep in mind, though, addiction is fraught with many complex issues.  Length of habit, motivation...

speaker: Boone
text: Forgive me, sometimes I don't express myself too clearly. When I say, "could you help her," what I meant to say was [_definite:_] HELP HER!

speaker: Frasier
text: Consider it done.

speaker: Boone
text: Much obliged.  She'll be in touch. [_exits_]

speaker: Frasier
text: That's me, Dr. Frasier Crane, bimbo wrangler.

speaker: Roz
text: Frasier, stop it! This is a golden opportunity!  You make this little tootsie quit smoking and we're halfway to syndication.

speaker: Bebe
text: [_enters booth:_] Did someone just say the word "syndication," or do I just hear it every time I lay eyes on my favorite client?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Bebe. [_they kiss cheeks, he continues to moan_]

speaker: Bebe
text: Is something wrong, dear?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, yes.

speaker: Roz
text: We just met Big Willy...

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, he thinks I'm some sort of a magician.  He wants me to play therapist to his little fiancee.  No doubt some gold- digging piranha so devoid of scruples that she's willing to rob the coffin and just...  _Frasier notices that Bebe and Big Willy and now exchanging kisses through the glass partition._

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, dear God!

speaker: Bebe
text: Isn't it wonderful?  We met last month and it was love at first sight.

speaker: Roz
text: First sight of what - his bankbook and a cardiogram? Two minutes. [_exits to booth_]

speaker: Bebe
text: I'm hurt that she can even joke about such a thing.  I love that dear sweet old man with every fibre of my being. [_lights a cigarette_]

speaker: Frasier
text: [_sarcastic:_] I'm sure you do.  I'm afraid there won't even be a wedding if you can't get rid of that rotten habit, and he's just ordered me to see that you do!

speaker: Bebe
text: God, you'd think a touch of emphysema were the end of the world!

speaker: Boone
text: [_enters_] What's that in your hand, woman?

speaker: Bebe
text: Sorry, pudd'n.  Bebe slipped.

speaker: Frasier
text: Just that all-important last puff. [_stubbs it out for her_]

speaker: Boone
text: Well, see that it is!  Well, Dr. Crane, I'm heading out of town for three days.  When I get back on Sunday, I expect my little gal here to be smoke-free by then.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_worried_] In... three days?

speaker: Boone
text: Now, you do whatever it takes to help her, doc!  Drugs, straightjackets, electroshock... [_exits_]

speaker: Bebe
text: You see how he dotes on me.  _Frasier gives her a "yeah, right" smile.  FADE TO:_  _Scene Three - Frasier's Apartment. Bebe is laying on the couch as Frasier wanders around the room creating a stereotypical psychiatrist scene._

speaker: Frasier
text: Excellent progress, Bebe!  You've really dived into the emotional void that is the route of your addiction.  Your fear of abandonment, your fear that those you trust will suddenly turn their backs when you expect them to... [_doorbell sounds_] Excuse me.

speaker: Bebe
text: My God, it all seems so clear now.  You're a miracle worker.

speaker: Frasier
text: If I had a dime for every time... well... [_opens door_] Niles!

speaker: Niles
text: Hello Frasier, I noticed you were out of capers the other night, so I got you this.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you Niles, but why so many?

speaker: Niles
text: I just discovered a place called "Price Buster's Warehouse." You have to buy in bulk, but the savings are extraordinary and they have a huge selection.  I found french fries and french doors in the same aisle.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, the next time you go back be sure to buy me a thousand swordfish so I can use these up!

speaker: Niles
text: You laugh, but I could do it like that. [_snaps fingers_] So, how goes the great smoke-out?

speaker: Bebe
text: Until today, I had no idea what a brilliant therapist your brother is.  He has tunneled his way into the very depths of my psyche.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, let's hope he sent a canary down first.

speaker: Bebe
text: Well, I'll be running along. [_to Frasier_] I'll see you at ten tomorrow.  In the mean time, it's exercise, lots of fresh spring water and nicotine gum for cravings.

speaker: Frasier
text: That's my girl.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, Bebe, you know I'm writing a paper on addiction and I'd love to ask you some questions - unless there's some reason you're eager to be off?

speaker: Bebe
text: [_covering up:_] Me?  No.  No, not at all.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, I just need to discuss a personal matter with Frasier first.

speaker: Bebe
text: Of course, I'll give you some privacy.  It's time for my water anyway. [_exits to kitchen_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, Niles?

speaker: Niles
text: Let her out that door, she'll smoke half a pack before the elevator hits the lobby.

speaker: Frasier
text: How can you know that?  You hardly spoke to her.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, obviously you didn't see the crazed, cunning glint in her eyes.

speaker: Frasier
text: She always looks like that, she's an agent.

speaker: Niles
text: I know about addiction.  It's the exact same look Maris used to get during the cough syrup years.  The only way to deal with it is to lock her up, take her money, and watch her like a hawk until it's out of her system.

speaker: Frasier
text: That means she would have to stay here for the weekend. _Daphne and Martin have entered and they have heard Frasier's last sentence._

speaker: Daphne
text: Who's staying all weekend?

speaker: Niles
text: Bebe Glazer.

speaker: Martin
text: [_worried:_] Here?

speaker: Daphne
text: [_worried:_] What does she have to stay here for?

speaker: Frasier
text: She's trying to quit smoking.

speaker: Martin
text: [_sarcastic:_] Oh great, that means she'll be extra lovable.

speaker: Frasier
text: Not to worry dad, there is no reason she has to stay for the weekend.  Bebe and I made a real breakthrough today.  If you don't believe me, just come on into the kitchen and you'll see that I'm right. _Meanwhile Bebe is smoking in the kitchen.  When she hears the previous she licks her fingers, stubbs out her cigarette and puts it in her handbag._

speaker: Bebe
text: [_exiting the kitchen_] I'm sorry I can't stay and help you with your paper, Niles, wedding preperations and all.  But I'll remember those helpful hints.  It's exercise, gum, and lots of water. _Bebe turns round and we see that blue smoke is wafting out of her handbag._

speaker: Niles
text: Water should come in handy for putting out those pesky purse fires.

speaker: Frasier
text: All right Niles, secure the door!  Bebe, you are not going anywhere, you're staying for the weekend.  Now give me that purse.

speaker: Bebe
text: All right.  Let me remove one very precious momento.

speaker: Frasier
text: Very well.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, stop it! [_yanks it away from her_]  _END OF ACT ONE (Time: 10:10)  ACT TWO  Scene One - Frasier's Apartment. Niles, Frasier, Martin and Daphne are crowded around the dinner table as Bebe eats like a scavenger._

speaker: Bebe
text: More!

speaker: Daphne
text: What again?

speaker: Martin
text: That's her third serving.

speaker: Frasier
text: Now, now Dad, it's flattering to Daphne that Bebe finds her food so tasty.

speaker: Bebe
text: I'm orally fixated.  I could eat a half-stunned wharf rat if you put some gravy on it!

speaker: Daphne
text: I'll bear that in mind come breakfast time.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, please, please.  Let's all try to remain supportive of Bebe.  I think she's really doing rather well.

speaker: Niles
text: So, I hear your fiancee is well to do?

speaker: Bebe
text: Very. [_to Martin:_] You gonna eat that fat? [_takes it from him_]

speaker: Niles
text: Well, marrying money can have it's perils.  Ten or fifteen years down the line, after you've adapted to a lifestyle now totally beyond your means, you can find yourself cast aside a hollow husk, penniless and crushed.

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, Big Willy's eighty-five, he's on his third pacemaker.

speaker: Niles
text: Ah. [_raises his glass to Bebe_] Mazel tov!

speaker: Martin
text: Just out of curiosity, has this guy ever seen you eat?

speaker: Bebe
text: After dinner is the time I need a cigarette most.  As long as I don't stop eating, I'll be fine.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, this is very good, Bebe.  You're already identifying those moments that trigger your worst cravings.

speaker: Bebe
text: [_dismissive:_] Yeah, yeah!

speaker: Frasier
text: No, really.  Perhaps it would help to know that you're not alone.  Dad is an ex-smoker.  Dad, can you tell us about those moments you crave a cigarette most?

speaker: Martin
text: Ah, when I had insomnia.  I'd get up, pour a water glass full of Bourbon, light a cigarette - next thing you know, I couldn't keep my eyes open.  Nothing relaxes you like a cigarette. [_Bebe gazes at him longingly_] Of course, gives you a hell of a headache in the morning.

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, I smoked for years but I never became addicted. To this day, I can buy a pack, have a cig or two, toss them in a drawer and not crave another for months.

speaker: Bebe
text: You know there's a word for people who can do that. What is it?  Oh, yes - bitch!

speaker: Niles
text: There's no need to be insulting just because you're wrestling with an unhealthy and disgusting habit.

speaker: Bebe
text: It isn't disgusting, it's wonderful!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh now, Bebe, tell me.  What is so wonderful about smoking?

speaker: Bebe
text: Everything. [_with actions:_] I like the way a fresh firm pack feels in my hand.  I like peeling away that little piece of cellophane and seeing it twinkle in the light.  I like coaxing that first sweet cylinder out of its hiding place and bringing it slowly up to my lips. [_Daphne comes back with a bowl; getting more erotic:_] Striking a match, watching it burst into a perfect little flame and knowing that soon that flame will be inside me. [_laughs giddily_] I love the first puff, pulling it into my lungs.  Little fingers of smoking filling me, caressing me, feeling that warmth penetrate deeper and deeper, until I think I'm going to burst!  Then - whoosh! - watching it flow out of me in a lovely, sinuous cloud, no two ever quite the same. _She's cast her spell.  Everyone now has a hungry, longing look in their eyes._

speaker: Daphne
text: More potatoes, anyone?  _No sooner has she put them on the table than everybody leaps at them quickly putting as much as they can on their plates.  FADE TO:  Scene Two - Frasier's Apartment. It is half past five in the morning when Bebe is fast asleep on the couch.  Daphne, in her dressing gown, slowly creeps into the room. She has a pack of cigarettes in her hand.  She checks that Bebe is fast asleep, then slowly opens the balcony door so as not to awake her.  She stays fast asleep as Daphne puts the cigarette to her lips.  Daphne strikes a match.  Bebe wakes up in an instant.  The sound is precious to her so she goes over to the balcony door._

speaker: Bebe
text: You're up early, Miss Moon.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_spins around_] Oh!  God, you startled me! [_chuckles nervously_] Ever since your little speech about smoking, I haven't been able to think about anything else.  Please, don't mention this to Dr. Crane.

speaker: Bebe
text: Silence has its price, dear.  And I think we both know what that is.

speaker: Daphne
text: Forget it!  You can't make me give you one of these.

speaker: Bebe
text: Oh... can't I?!

speaker: Daphne
text: You open up right now!

speaker: Bebe
text: All right, missy, here's the drill!  You drop those cigarettes, I'll open the door, you kick 'em over to me, _capisce_?

speaker: Daphne
text: No!

speaker: Bebe
text: [_getting to her:_] Oh, is it cold outside?

speaker: Daphne
text: All right, you asked for it!

speaker: Bebe
text: No!  No!  Please, I beg you.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, oh no.  My fingers are getting weak.  Oh, oh, I'm losing my grip.

speaker: Bebe
text: Stop, please!  I'll give you anything you want.  I'll... [_quickly:_] I'll make you a star!

speaker: Frasier
text: What the hell's going on out here?

speaker: Bebe
text: [_childishly_] Daphne was smoking!

speaker: Daphne
text: She made me!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_opens the door_] Daphne, give me those.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_does so and enters_] Oh, look at me!  I'm all damp and chilled to the bone.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'll get you a towel.  My God, it's five-thirty in the morning! [_opens the powder room door_] Dad!  _Martin stumbles out of the powder room with a glass of bourbon. He coughs up a puff of smoke and hides the glass behind his back._

speaker: Martin
text: I couldn't sleep.

speaker: Frasier
text: Have you people all lost your minds? [_throws Daphne a towel_] Alright, now listen, get back to bed, every one of you!

speaker: Martin
text: All right, all right...

speaker: Bebe
text: Thank god you came in when you did!  She was praying on my weakness.  Who knows what I might have done, probably... THIS!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, get her!  Stop that woman!  _Martin blocks Bebe.  Daphne gets in her way and Bebe throws her onto the couch._

speaker: Frasier
text: Bebe, you will not be allowed to smoke a cigarette in this house! [_she tries to edge around him_] No, no, don't even think about it!  All right, just give me those!

speaker: Frasier
text: All right now, that's it!  Back to bed!  _He turns back to the hallway, but Bebe jumps on his back, reaching for the packet and snarling like a wild animal._

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh my God, you're insane, woman!

speaker: Martin
text: That's it, no more house guests.  _Martin exits to his bedroom.  Frasier pins Bebe to the floor, with the pack trapped underneath her._

speaker: Bebe
text: Get off me, you brute!

speaker: Frasier
text: Hand them over!

speaker: Bebe
text: Never! [_phone rings_]

speaker: Daphne
text: That'll be the neighbours! [_answers:_] Hello?  Oh, hello! One moment, please. [_whispering:_] It's Big Willy!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_takes phone and nicely as Bebe struggles:_] Big Willy, hello! No, no, it's not too early, everybody's up! [_Bebe growls_] Well, you know, there have been a few minor setbacks, but I'm keeping on top of her, yeah. [_Bebe growls again_] Oh yeah, I know she'd love to say hi, hang on. _Bebe's growling and thrashing abruptly stop as soon as he puts the phone to her ear._

speaker: Bebe
text: [_sweet:_] Hello, pudd'n.  I'm fine, and you?  Oh, nothing's too much trouble for you daddy.  Bye now!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_takes phone:_] Yes, sir?  Oh, oh, really?  No, no, I'm very flattered.  Yes, of course, I'd love to, I'll talk to you this evening.  Bye-bye. [_hands phone to Daphne_] Thank you, Daphne. [_to Bebe:_] All right, now listen up!  He thinks I'm very gifted.

speaker: Bebe
text: Mmm.

speaker: Frasier
text: He thinks I'm wasting my talents in just one city!  My God, woman, he wants to take me national, don't you get it? Unless YOU ruin it for me!

speaker: Bebe
text: [_cries_] Oh my God, sorry.  Here, take 'em. [_hands over packet; he lets her up_] I don't know what came over me.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, don't be too hard on yourself, Bebe.  After all, addiction to Nicotine is a very, very difficult... hey, wait a minute.  This pack is half-empty! _Bebe runs out onto the balcony with half a dozen cigarettes, puts one in her mouth, and pats her pockets for a light._

speaker: Frasier
text: For God's sake... I don't care anymore.  You know, I can't help you, nobody can.  You want to ruin it for both of us? Here, [_tosses her a lighter_] go ahead, knock yourself out. [_Bebe begins to light cigarette_] I only wish I could be there when it happens.

speaker: Bebe
text: [_stops_] When what happens?

speaker: Frasier
text: When you see that newspaper headline: "Big Willy Boone, Millionaire, Dead."

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, how I wish I could be there when you watch the funeral on the news.  Watch the casket being slipped into the ground. Only, you won't be watching that.  No, no, you'll be watching... the widow Boone.  Tiffany, perhaps.  Oh no, better yet, "Kelli" - with an "I"!

speaker: Bebe
text: Stop it!

speaker: Frasier
text: You'll picture her wearing YOUR jewels, sailing in YOUR yachts, sleeping with YOUR gigolos - but, oh, you won't be sad, no, no, no! [_chuckles_] Because you'll have your cigarette.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yeah!  Clutched in your nicotine-stained teeth, smoke whirling about your once-pretty, now creased, leathery, smoke-ravaged...

speaker: Bebe
text: Enough! [_Frasier looks at her triumphantly_] God! [_hands over cigarettes and comes in_] You are one hell of a therapist.  _Frasier closes the door.  Bebe lets out a sigh and sinks back onto the couch.  FADE TO:_  **THREE SMOKE-FREE WEEKS LATER**  _Scene Three - Frasier's Apartment. Bebe is dressed in her wedding gown on the balcony.  She has her back turned away from us and her veil is covering her face.  Roz and Frasier, formally dressed, are sitting on the couch looking glum as Martin enters._

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, you back from the wedding already?

speaker: Roz
text: No.

speaker: Frasier
text: There was no wedding.

speaker: Roz
text: No wedding, no syndication deal...

speaker: Martin
text: [_notices Bebe:_] What's she doing here?

speaker: Roz
text: No money, no fame...

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, you might say things hit a bit of a snag.

speaker: Roz
text: No beach house, no pool boys...

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh will you get a grip, Roz?!

speaker: Martin
text: Well, what went wrong?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, they were halfway down the aisle - Big Willy beaming proudly, Bebe radiant, supporting Big Willy on her arm - when suddenly he clutched his heart, and his head slumped against Bebe's shoulder.  Of course we were all concerned at first, but then suddenly it seemed like he was all right because they kept moving on down the aisle.  But if you looked carefully, you could see Bebe's little biceps bulging through her wedding gown, and I swear I noticed daylight between Big Willy's dress boots and the carpet.  Well, once they got up to the minister the jig was pretty well up, despite Bebe's valiant attempts to animate his features by twisting the loose skin at the back of his neck. [_imitates_] You know, I've never seen a woman more crushed.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, if I were you I'd get her away from that balcony rail. The doorman gets ticked if you even through a piece of gum over the side. [_exits_]

speaker: Frasier
text: [_opening balcony door:_] Bebe, dear?  Please, come on in. [_she does_] That's a girl.  All right, let me have a look at you.  Come on, here we are. _Frasier lifts the veil to reveal Bebe with a cigarette clenched between her teeth._

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I don't really blame you, dear.  You know, Roz and I are both upset too.  You know, look at it this way: at least you're no worse off than you were before.

speaker: Bebe
text: [_angrily stubs out her cigarette_] You don't know the things I did for that man - the depraved, Western-themed appetites I satisfied!

speaker: Roz
text: He was eighty-five, how bad could it have been?

speaker: Bebe
text: Ever worn a saddle? [_Frasier grimaces_]

speaker: Roz
text: Do I have to answer that?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, you know, Bebe, there are other Big Willys out there, better ones!  Richer, older... [_she's not convinced_] Impotent!

speaker: Bebe
text: [_cheering up_] Oh dear, you always know what to say.  I know what hell I put you through over this.  I insist that you take this, [_hands over something_] as a small token of my gratitude.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh Bebe, really... [_gasps_] Look, Roz!  It's a gold Rolex! Oh my goodness...

speaker: Frasier
text: [_realizes_] Bebe... where did you get this?

speaker: Bebe
text: [_beat_] Just don't wear it to the funeral.  _She leaves.  Frasier debates whether he really wants the watch or not.  He holds it out to Roz, who recoils in disgust.  END OF ACT TWO (Time: 21:05)_
